title: Business & Finance
text:
The effects of the de facto buyers' strike on Russian crude that began a month ago, propelling prices to their highest levels in years, are starting to create a second wave of impact on oil markets.

Russia's invasion of Ukraine is driving up the price of renewable-energy projects, which were facing supply-chain strains and raw-materials increases before the war.

---

Socially conscious investors and global-health activists are turning to shareholders to press Pfizer, Moderna and J&J to make more of their Covid-19 vaccine shots available to people in poorer countries.

---

Volkswagen is changing its approaches to manufacturing as war, health scares and trade disputes roll back decades of globalization.

---

Aluminum makers are on a nationwide hunt for more old cans, shredded cars and factory waste to keep up with demand.

---

The turmoil in Chinese tech shares is damping the financial firepower Japan's SoftBank has for new investments, and prompting debate about whether it might sell some of its stake in Alibaba.
